title: Lesson 71
paragraph: This lesson focuses on truth and reason, including verifiability, logic, and coherence.

words.meaning: able to be checked or demonstrated to be true
words.japaneseMeaning: 検証可能な、確認できる

words.example: Her argument was logical and persuasive.

words.japaneseMeaning: 実証された、証明された
words.example: The claims were substantiated by research.

words.meaning: based on reason rather than emotion
words.example: He made a rational decision under pressure.

words.meaning: not influenced by personal feelings or opinions
words.example: The report provided an objective analysis of the situation.

words.meaning: based on observation or experience rather than theory
words.example: The study provided empirical evidence supporting the theory.

words.meaning: concerned with what is actually the case; based on facts
words.example: The article contained only factual information.

words.japaneseMeaning: 一貫した、首尾一貫した
words.example: His speech was coherent and easy to follow.

words.meaning: acting or done in the same way over time
words.japaneseMeaning: 首尾一貫した、一貫性のある
words.example: Her performance has been consistent throughout the season.

words.japaneseMeaning: 信頼できる、もっともらしい
words.example: The witness gave a credible account of the events.
